intro: Cleome silvatica, commonly known as the swamp cleome, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows in moist, wetland environments. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its stems are often hairy and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Cleome silvatica is valued for its ability to thrive in wet conditions and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
